channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Brice Oligui Nguema Is Favored to Win Gabon Election
item.description: A military officer who seized power but promised to step down is expected to win the presidential vote on Saturday.

item.title: Judge Declines to Block Immigration Enforcement Operations in Places of Worship
item.description: The ruling cast doubt on claims by a coalition of Christian and Jewish groups that their congregations were at heightened risk of becoming targets for...

item.title: For Taiwan’s Small Exporters, the Uncertainty’s as Bad as the Tariffs
item.description: The island’s many small factories have thrived by being frugal — and flexible. But President Trump’s unpredictability is testing their limits.

item.title: What to Know About U.S. Talks With Iran Over Its Nuclear Program
item.description: The two sides are set to negotiate on Saturday, though expectations for a breakthrough are modest, and distrust high.

item.title: Boeing Helped Power Russia’s Economy. Could It Return?
item.description: Moscow is hinting that the company would be welcome back as part of a thaw under President Trump. Industry skepticism runs deep.

item.title: What to Know About U.S. Talks With Iran Over Its Nuclear Program
item.description: The two sides are set to negotiate on Saturday, though expectations for a breakthrough are modest, and distrust high.

item.title: For Taiwan’s Small Exporters, the Uncertainty’s as Bad as the Tariffs
item.description: The island’s many small factories have thrived by being frugal — and flexible. But President Trump’s unpredictability is testing their limits.

item.title: Boeing Helped Power Russia’s Economy. Could It Return?
item.description: Moscow is hinting that the company would be welcome back as part of a thaw under President Trump. Industry skepticism runs deep.

item.title: Brice Oligui Nguema Is Favored to Win Gabon Election
item.description: A military officer who seized power but promised to step down is expected to win the presidential vote on Saturday.

item.title: Stocks Post Gains, but Bond Market Signals Investors Are Anxious
item.description: The slumping dollar and increase in yields on U.S. government bonds were signs that the world’s faith in the United States economy had been shaken.

item.title: The helicopter company in the deadly NYC crash that killed an executive and his whole family recently emerged from bankruptcy and already faces a $1.4 million lawsuit
item.description: New York Helicopter had difficulties before one of its sightseeing choppers plummeted into the Hudson River, killing all six people aboard.

item.title: GM reveals the real reason its halting Canadian production and laying off workers—and it’s not Trump’s tariffs
item.description: Canada's subsidiary of General Motors is temporarily halting production and cutting staff at an assembly plant in Ingersoll, Ontario.

item.title: Stocks jump at end of roller-coaster week while de-dollarization trade continues to slam the greenback and U.S. bonds
item.description: Elsewhere in financial markets, the mood was gloomier and pointed to deteriorating confidence in U.S. assets.

item.title: Trump tariffs backfire on Elon Musk, as Tesla pulls U.S.-built models from China
item.description: Tesla has stopped taking orders for the Model S and Model X in China, which now face retaliatory 125% import duties levied by Beijing.

item.title: 12 former OpenAI employees asked to be heard in Elon Musk’s lawsuit against the company; one calls Sam Altman a ‘person of low integrity’
item.description: In a friend of the court filing by Harvard law professor Lawrence Lessig, a dozen former employees accuse OpenAI of abandoning its nonprofit roots and...
